headline: More Powers, Few Limits And a Volatile President
abstract: The killing of Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani is the latest example of the capricious way in which the president, as commander in chief, has chosen to flex his lethal powers.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON â€” The powers of an American president to wage war have grown stronger for nearly two decades, ever since the Sept. 11 attacks led the United States into an era of perpetual conflict.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
